comment.text: libmspack is in RHEL7, note FEDORA-EPEL-2017-e27758bd23

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14679 libmspack: off-by-one error in the CHM PMGI/PMGL chunk number validity checks

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14679 libmspack: off-by-one error in the CHM PMGI/PMGL chunk number validity checks

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.7alpha. There is an off-by-one error in the CHM PMGI/PMGL chunk number validity checks, which could lead to denial of service (uninitialized data dereference and application crash)


References:
http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/07/28/1
https://bugs.debian.org/904802

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/kyz/libmspack/commit/72e70a921f0f07fee748aec2274b30784e1d312a

Created libmspack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1610891]

Created libmspack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1610932]

Statement:

This issue affects the versions of libmspack as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2018:3327 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3327

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an

Fixed by rebasing Fedora 27, 28 and Rawhide to 0.7alpha.

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14681 libmspack: Out-of-bounds Write in kwajd_read_headers in mspack/kwajd.c [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14681 libmspack: Out-of-bounds Write in kwajd_read_headers in mspack/kwajd.c [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-14681 libmspack: out-of-bounds write in kwajd_read_headers in mspack/kwajd.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in kwajd_read_headers in mspack/kwajd.c in libmspack before 0.7alpha. A maliciously crafted KWAJ file header extensions could cause a one or two byte overwrite.


References:
http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2018/07/28/1
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=904799

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/kyz/libmspack/commit/0b0ef9344255ff5acfac6b7af09198ac9c9756c8

Created libmspack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1610897]

Created libmspack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1610933]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2018:3327 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:3327
